entity_long: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti
combined: United Nations Integrated Office in Haiti (BINUH)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: BINUH focusses on the provision of advisory services and good offices in Haiti and aims to help create the conditions needed for sustainable development in.

entity_long: United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination
combined: United Nations System Chief Executives Board for Coordination (CEB)
description: The CEB is the prime instrument for strengthening the coordination role of the UN inter-governnmental bodies on social, economic annd related matters.

entity_long: United Nations support for the Cameroon-Nigeria Mixed Commission
combined: United Nations support for the Cameroon-Nigeria Mixed Commission (CNMC)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
comment: Chaired by SRSG for West Africa and the Sahel
description: The goal of the CNMC is to facilitate the implementation of the 10 October 2002 judgment of the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on the Cameroon-Nigeria boundary dispute.

entity_long: Preparatory Commission for the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization
combined: Preparatory Commission for the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty Organization (CTBTO)
description: The CTBTO Preparatory Commission is mandated to carry out the necessary preparations for the entry into force and effective implementation of the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT).

entity_long: Counter-Terrorism Committee Executive Directorate
combined: Counter-Terrorism Committee Executive Directorate (CTED)
description: The CTC works to bolster the ability of United Nations Member States to prevent terrorist acts both within their borders and across regions.

entity_long: Development Account
combined: Development Account (DA)
comment: conducted by ECE

entity_long: Department of Economic and Social Affairs
combined: Department of Economic and Social Affairs (DESA)
description: UN DESA helps countries translate their global commitments into national action in the economic, social and environmental spheres.

entity_long: Department for General Assembly and Conference Management
combined: Department for General Assembly and Conference Management (DGACM)
description: The DGACM enhances dialogue and cooperation among Member States and, by doing so, to contributes to the realization of the objectives of the United Nations and of the Millennium Development Goals.

entity_long: Department of Global Communications
combined: Department of Global Communications (DGC)
description: The DGC is dedicated to communicating the ideals and work of the United Nations to the world across multiple platforms, helping build support for peace, sustainable development and human rights for all.

entity_long: Department of Management Strategy, Policy and Compliance
combined: Department of Management Strategy, Policy and Compliance (DMSPC)
description: The DMSPC serves the United Nations globally to drive organizational excellence through innovation, accountability and solutions.

entity_long: Department of Operational Support
combined: Department of Operational Support (DOS)
description: The DOS provides operational support to UN Secretariat entities, including advisory, operational and transactional support services and, where needed, exercises delegated authority on behalf of clients.

entity_long: Department of Peace Operations
combined: Department of Peace Operations (DPO)
description: The DPO is dedicated to assisting the Member States and the Secretary-General in their efforts to maintain international peace and security.

entity_long: Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs
combined: Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs (DPPA)
description: DPPA monitors and assesses global political developments with an eye to detecting potential crises before they erupt and devising effective responses.

entity_long: Department of Safety and Security
combined: Department of Safety and Security (DSS)
description: The UNDSS provides critical advice and rapid decision-making capacity on UNSMS policy and operational issues to UNSMS members, senior United Nations management and personnel.

entity_long: Economic Commission for Africa
combined: Economic Commission for Africa (ECA)
comment: Its secretariat is part of the UN Secretariat.
description: The ECA's mandate is to promote the economic and social development of its member States, foster intra-regional integration, and promote international cooperation for Africa's development.

entity_long: Economic Commission for Europe
combined: Economic Commission for Europe (ECE)
comment: Its secretariat is part of the UN Secretariat.
description: As a multilateral platform, UNECE facilitates greater economic integration and cooperation among its member countries and promotes sustainable development and economic prosperity.

entity_long: Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean
combined: Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC)
comment: Its secretariat is part of the UN Secretariat.
description: The ECLAC coordinates policies for the promotion of sustainable Latin American and Carriibean economic development and to foster regional and international trade.

entity_long: Ethics Office
combined: Ethics Office (EO)

entity_long: Executive Office of the Secretary-General
combined: Executive Office of the Secretary-General (EOSG)
description: The EOSG assists the Secretary-General with relations with members and organs of the United Nations and with specialized agencies and non-governmental organizations, as well as to assist with policy and coordination of the Secretariat.

entity_long: Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific
combined: Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (ESCAP)
comment: Its secretariat is part of the UN Secretariat.
description: ESCAP serves as the regional arm of the UN in economic, social and related fields, it promotes the inclusive and sustainable economic and social development in the Asia-Pacific region

entity_long: Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia
combined: Economic and Social Commission for Western Asia (ESCWA)
comment: Its secretariat is part of the UN Secretariat.
description: The purpose of ESCWA is to stimulate economic activity in member countries, strengthen cooperation between them and promote development.

entity_long: Food and Agriculture Organization
combined: Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)
description: The FAO aims to: raise levels of nutrition and standards of living secure improvements in food production and distribution better the conditions of rural people and contribute toward an expanding world economy and ensure freedom from hunger.

entity_long: Group of Experts on the Democratic Republic of the Congo
combined: Group of Experts on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (GoE-DRC)
comment: Entity is comprised of support staff members.

entity_long: International Atomic Energy Agency
combined: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA)
description: The purpose of the IAEA is to promote and accelerate the contribution atomic energy makes to peace, health and prosperity throughout the world.

entity_long: International Civil Aviation Organization
combined: International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO)
description: The ICAO is charged with developing international air navigation and fostering the planning and development of international air transport to ensure the growth of international civil aviation.

entity_long: International Criminal Court
combined: International Criminal Court (ICC)
description: ​The ICC investigates and tries individuals charged with the gravest crimes of concern to the international community: genocide, war crimes, crimes against humanity and the crime of aggression.

entity_long: International Court of Justice
combined: International Court of Justice (ICJ)
description: The Court’s role is to settle legal disputes submitted to it by States and to give advisory opinions on legal questions referred to it by authorized United Nations organs and specialized agencies.

entity_long: International Civil Service Commission
combined: International Civil Service Commission (ICSC)
comment: Its secretariat is financed as UN Secretariat.
description: The ICSC's focus is to strengthen and maintain high standards in the international civil service, while balancing the needs and concerns of its major stakeholders.

entity_long: International Fund for Agricultural Development
combined: International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD)
description: The IFAD is an international financial institution and UN specialised agency dedicated to eradicating poverty in rural areas of developing countries.

entity_long: International, Impartial and Independent Mechanism to Assist in the Investigation and Prosecution of Persons Responsible for the Most Serious Crimes under International Law Committed in the Syrian Arab Republic since March 2011
combined: International, Impartial and Independent Mechanism to Assist in the Investigation and Prosecution of Persons Responsible for the Most Serious Crimes under International Law Committed in the Syrian Arab Republic since March 2011 (IIIM)
description: The Mechanism’s mandate, is “to collect, consolidate, preserve and analyse evidence of violations of international humanitarian law and human rights violations and abuses.

entity_long: Independent Investigative Mechanism for Myanmar
combined: Independent Investigative Mechanism for Myanmar (IIMM)

entity_long: International Labor Organization
combined: International Labor Organization (ILO)
description: The ILO was founded in 1919, its Constitution forming part of the Treaty of Versailles. The ILO became the first specialised agency of the UN in 1946.

entity_long: International Monetary Fund
combined: International Monetary Fund (IMF)

entity_long: International Maritime Organization
combined: International Maritime Organization (IMO)
description: The IMO is responsible for the safety of life at sea, maritime security and the protection of the marine environment through prevention of sea pollution caused by ships.

entity_long: International Organization for Migration
combined: International Organization for Migration (IOM)
description: The IOM is the leading intergovernmental organization in the field of migration and is committed to the principle that humane and orderly migration benefits migrants and society.

entity_long: International Seabed Authority
combined: International Seabed Authority (ISA)
description: The ISA is mandated under the UN Convention on the Law of the Sea to organize, regulate and control all mineral-related activities in the international seabed area for the benefit of mankind as a whole.

entity_long: International Trade Centre
combined: International Trade Centre (ITC)
description: The ITC supports the United Nations and WTO's regulatory research and policy strategies, and focuses on implementing and delivering trade related technical assistance projects (TRTA).

entity_long: International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea
combined: International Tribunal for the Law of the Sea (ITLOS)
description: The ITLOS is an independent judicial body established by the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea to adjudicate disputes regarding all ocean space, its uses and resources.

entity_long: International Telecommunication Union
combined: International Telecommunication Union (ITU)
description: The ITU is an inter-governmental organization that brings together governments and industry to coordinate the establishment and operation of global telecommunication networks and services.

entity_long: Joint Inspection Unit
combined: Joint Inspection Unit (JIU)
description: The JIU is the only independent external oversight body of the United Nations system mandated to conduct evaluations, inspections and investigations system-wide.

entity_long: United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara
combined: United Nations Mission for the Referendum in Western Sahara (MINURSO)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: MINURSO is mandated in accordance with the settlement plan which provides for a transitional period for the preparation of a referendum in which the people of Western Sahara would choose between independence and integration with Morocco.

entity_long: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic
combined: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (MINUSCA)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: MINUSCA is a UN peacekeeping mission, which started on April 10, 2014, to protect Central African Republic civilians under Chapter VII of the UN Charter.

entity_long: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
combined: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: MONUSCO's mandate relates to, among other things, to the protection of civilians, humanitarian personnel and human rights defenders under imminent threat of physical violence and to support the Government of the DRC in its stabilization and peace consolidation efforts.

entity_long: Office of Administration of Justice
combined: Office of Administration of Justice (OAJ)

entity_long: Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
combined: Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)
description: With its partners, OCHA contributes to principled and effective humanitarian response through coordination, advocacy, policy, information management and humanitarian financing tools and services.

entity_long: Office of Counter-Terrorism
combined: Office of Counter-Terrorism (OCT)
description: The UNOCT works closely with UN Member States, UN entities, civil society, and other related stakeholders, strengthening existing and developing new partnerships to effectively prevent and counter terrorism.

entity_long: Office for Disarmament Affairs
combined: Office for Disarmament Affairs (ODA)
description: The ODA supports multilateral efforts aimed at achieving the ultimate goal of general and complete disarmament under strict and effective international control.

entity_long: Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
combined: Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies (ODET)

entity_long: Office of Data Protection and Privacy
combined: Office of Data Protection and Privacy (ODPP)

combined: Office of the Focal Point for De-listing (OFP-Delisting)

entity_long: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights
combined: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR)
description: The ONHCR promotes and protects the effective enjoyment by all people of all civil, cultural, economic, political and social rights, including the right to development.

entity_long: Office of Information and Communications Technology
combined: Office of Information and Communications Technology (OICT)
description: The OICT defines the strategic direction for ICT to the Secretariat. It provides oversight of ICT programmes, budgets and decision-making to ensure alignment with the Secretariat’s overall ICT strategy.

entity_long: Office of Internal Oversight Services
combined: Office of Internal Oversight Services (OIOS)
description: The OIOS assists the Secretary-General in fulfilling his oversight responsibilities in respect of the resources and staff of the Organization through the provision of audit, investigation, inspection and evaluation services.

entity_long: Office of Legal Affairs
combined: Office of Legal Affairs (OLA)
description: OLA provides a unified central legal service for the Secretariat and other entities of the United Nations and contributes to the progressive development and codification of international public and trade law.

combined: Office of the Ombudsperson established pursuant to Security Council resolution 1904 (2009) (OMBUD-RES1904)
comment: Entity is comprised of support staff members.
description: The Ombudsperson gathers information and interacts with the petitioner, relevant States and organizations with regard to delisting requests and present a comprehensive report to the Security Council’s ISIL (Da'esh) and Al-Qaida Sanctions Committee.

entity_long: Office of the United Nations Ombudsman and Mediation Services
combined: Office of the United Nations Ombudsman and Mediation Services (OMS)

entity_long: Office for Outer Space Affairs
combined: Office for Outer Space Affairs (OOSA)
description: UNOOSA is responsible for promoting international cooperation in the peaceful uses of outer space. It serves as the secretariat for the General Assembly's only committee dealing exclusively with international cooperation in the peaceful uses of outer space.

entity_long: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
combined: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
description: The role of the OPCW is to ensure the implementation of the provisions made under the Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on their Destruction (CWC).

combined: Office of the Special Adviser on Africa (OSAA)

entity_long: Resident Coordinator System
combined: Resident Coordinator System (RCS)

combined: United Nations Regional Service Centre in Entebbe (RSCE)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: The RSCE consolidates administrative and support functions, with the goal of providing client-orientated and scalable services while reducing the missions’ footprints to UN field missions across Africa.

combined: Support to the Security Council Committee established pursuant to resolution 1540 (2004) on the non-proliferation of all weapons of mass destruction (SC-RES1540)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Standing committees and ad hoc bodies)

combined: Support to the Security Council Committee established pursuant to resolution 1718 (2006) (SC-RES1718)

combined: Implementation of Security Council resolution 2231 (2015) (SC-RES2231)

combined: United Nations Sustainable Development Group System-wide Evaluation Office (SWEO)

combined: World Tourism Organization (UN Tourism)

entity_long: United Nations Human Settlements Programme
combined: United Nations Human Settlements Programme (UN-Habitat)

entity_long: Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States
combined: Office of the High Representative for the Least Developed Countries, Landlocked Developing Countries and Small Island Developing States (UN-OHRLLS)

entity_long: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women
combined: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women (UN-Women)
description: UN Women is dedicated to gender equality and the empowerment of women. A global champion for women and girls, UN Women was established to accelerate progress on meeting their needs worldwide.

entity_long: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS
combined: Joint United Nations Programme on HIV/AIDS (UNAIDS)
description: UNAIDS brings together the efforts and resources of 10 UN system organizations to help prevent new HIV infections, care for people living with HIV and mitigate the impact of the epidemic.

entity_long: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan
combined: United Nations Assistance Mission in Afghanistan (UNAMA)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNAMA’s mission is to support the people and institutions of Afghanistan in achieving peace and stability, in line with the rights and obligations enshrined in the Afghan constitution.

entity_long: United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq
combined: United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq (UNAMI)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNAMI’s advises and assists the Government and people of Iraq on a number of issues, including advancing inclusive political dialogue and national reconciliation, assisting in the electoral process and in the planning for a national census, and promoting the protection of human rights and judicial and legal reforms.

entity_long: United Nations Alliance of Civilizations
combined: United Nations Alliance of Civilizations (UNAOC)
description: The Alliance maintains a global network of partners including states, organizations, civil society groups, foundations, and the private sector to improve cross-cultural relations between diverse nations and communities.

entity_long: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development
combined: United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)
comment: Its secretariat is part of the UN Secretariat.
description: UNCTAD supports developing countries to access the benefits of a globalized economy more fairly and effectively and helps equip them to deal with the potential drawbacks of greater economic integration.

entity_long: United Nations Disengagement Observer Force
combined: United Nations Disengagement Observer Force (UNDOF)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: The UNDOF assists in maintaining the ceasefire between Israel and Syria, supervising the disengagement of Israeli and Syrian forces; as well as the areas of separation and limitation, as provided in the May 1974 Agreement on Disengagement.

entity_long: United Nations Development Programme
combined: United Nations Development Programme (UNDP)
description: The UNDP helps build inclusive, sustainable and resilient societies and provides expert advice, training and financial support. Special attention is paid to the needs of the Least Developed Countries and countries emerging from conflict.

entity_long: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction
combined: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR)
description: UNDRR (formerly UNISDR) is the United Nations focal point for disaster risk reduction.

entity_long: United Nations Environment Programme
combined: United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP)
comment: Its secretariat is part of the UN Secretariat.
description: The UNEP sets the global environmental agenda, promotes the coherent implementation of the environmental dimension of sustainable development within the United Nations system, and serves as an authoritative advocate for the global environment.

entity_long: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
combined: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)
description: UNESCO contributes to peace and security by promoting collaboration among nations through education, science and culture.

entity_long: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change Secretariat
combined: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change Secretariat (UNFCCC)
comment: Has its own governing and subsidiary bodies.
description: The UNFCCC is a treaty whereby countries jointly consider what they could do to limit average global temperature increases and the resulting climate change, and to cope with whatever impacts were, by then, inevitable.

entity_long: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus
combined: United Nations Peacekeeping Force in Cyprus (UNFICYP)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNFICYP has remained on the island to supervise ceasefire lines, maintain a buffer zone, undertake humanitarian activities and support the good offices mission of the Secretary-General.

entity_long: United Nations Population Fund
combined: United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA)
description: UNFPA is a United Nations development agency that promotes the right of every woman, man and child to enjoy a life of health and equal opportunity.

entity_long: United Nations Global Compact
combined: United Nations Global Compact (UNGC)

entity_long: United Nations Group of Experts on Geographical Names
combined: United Nations Group of Experts on Geographical Names (UNGEGN)

entity_long: Committee of Experts on Global Geospatial Information Management
combined: Committee of Experts on Global Geospatial Information Management (UNGGIM)
head_of_entity_name: Ingrid Vanden Berghe, Fernand Eanes Bale, Deirdre Dalpiaz Bishop
comment: As described in the Rules of Procedure, the United Nations Committee of Experts on Global Geospatial Information Management (UN-GGIM) elects up to three co-Chairs and a Rapporteur at the commencement of each session from among its Member State delegations

entity_long: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
combined: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)
description: The work of the Office of the UNHCR is humanitarian and non-political. Its principal functions are to provide international protection to refugees and other persons of concern, and to seek durable solutions for them.

entity_long: United Nations Children's Fund
combined: United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF)
description: The UN International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF) places an emphasis on programmes giving long-term benefits to children everywhere, particularly those in developing countries,

entity_long: United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research
combined: United Nations Institute for Disarmament Research (UNIDIR)
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council
description: The UNIDIR is an autonomous body of the UN, established by the General Assembly to carry out independent research on disarmament and related international security issues.

entity_long: United Nations Industrial Development Organization
combined: United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)
description: The UNIDO is the UN specialized agency mandated to promote industrial development and international industrial cooperation.

entity_long: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon
combined: United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (UNIFIL)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNIFIL was created to confirm Israeli withdrawal from Lebanon, restore international peace and security and assist the Lebanese Government in restoring its effective authority in the area.

entity_long: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei
combined: United Nations Interim Security Force for Abyei (UNISFA)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNISFA enhances the peace and stability, through operations to ensure that the Abyei Area is weapons-free and reducing intercommunal tensions by employing conflict prevention measures and promoting dialogue.

entity_long: United Nations Institute for Training and Research
combined: United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR)
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council
description: The UN Institute for training and Research (UNITAR) provides short-term executive training to Members States' national and local government officials, and representatives of civil society and the private sector.

entity_long: United Nations Logistics Base at Brindisi
combined: United Nations Logistics Base at Brindisi (UNLB)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
comment: by UN department of operational support
description: The logistics base at Brindisi provides logistic support, telecommunications and training for all peacekeeping operations around the world.

entity_long: United Nations Mission to Support the Hudaydah Agreement
combined: United Nations Mission to Support the Hudaydah Agreement (UNMHA)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
head_of_entity_title: Officer in charge and acting chair
description: UNMHA helps facilitate and coordinate UN support to assist the parties to fully implement the Hudaydah Agreement; leading and supporting the functioning of the Redeployment Coordination Committtee, monitoring the compliance of the parties of the ceasefire in the Hudayah governorate, and ensuring the region's security

entity_long: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo
combined: United Nations Interim Administration Mission in Kosovo (UNMIK)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: Following the declaration of independence by the Kosovo authorities in 2008, the UNMIK has been mandated to focus primarily on the promotion of security, stability and respect for human rights in Kosovo

entity_long: United Nations Mission in South Sudan
combined: United Nations Mission in South Sudan (UNMISS)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNMISS' efforts in South Sudan focus on the protection of civilians, delivering humanitarian assistance, supporting the implementation of the revitalized agreement and the peace process, and monitoring and investigating human rights

entity_long: United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan
combined: United Nations Military Observer Group in India and Pakistan (UNMOGIP)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNMOGIP supervises, in the State of Jammu and Kashmir, the ceasefire between India and Pakistan, and assists the Military Adviser to the United Nations Commission for India and Pakistan

entity_long: United Nations Office to the African Union
combined: United Nations Office to the African Union (UNOAU)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNOAU is mandated to enhance the partnership between the United Nations and the African Union in the area of peace and security and provide United Nations advice to the African Union on both long-term capacity-building and short-term operational support

entity_long: United Nations Regional Office for Central Africa
combined: United Nations Regional Office for Central Africa (UNOCA)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNOCA has a regional mandate to help prevent conflict and consolidate peace in Central Africa and provides assistance to support preventive diplomacy and mediation in situations of tension or potential conflict.

entity_long: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime
combined: United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC)
description: The UNODC is the secretariat of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Convention against Transnational Organized Crime and of the Conference of the States Parties to the UN Convention against Corruption.

entity_long: United Nations Office at Geneva
combined: United Nations Office at Geneva (UNOG)
description: The UNOG services more than 8,000 meetings every year, making it one of the busiest conference centres in the world. With more than 1,600 staff, it is the biggest duty stations outside of United Nations headquarters in New York.

entity_long: United Nations Office at Nairobi
combined: United Nations Office at Nairobi (UNON)
description: The UNON performs representation and liaison functions and facilitates cooperation between with permanent missions, the host-country and other Governments, and intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations in Nairobi.

entity_long: United Nations Office for Project Services
combined: United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS)
description: UNOPS' mission is to expand the capacity of the UN system and its partners to implement peace building, humanitarian and development operations that matter for people in need.

entity_long: United Nations Office at Vienna
combined: United Nations Office at Vienna (UNOV)
description: The UNOV performs representation and liaison functions with permanent missions to the United Nations (Vienna), the host Government and intergovernmental and non-governmental organizations in Vienna.

entity_long: United Nations Office for West Africa and the Sahel
combined: United Nations Office for West Africa and the Sahel (UNOWAS)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNOWAS has the responsibility for preventive diplomacy, good offices and political mediation and facilitation efforts in West Africa and the Sahel and works to consolidate peace and democratic governance in countries emerging from conflict or political crises.

entity_long: United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia
combined: United Nations Regional Centre for Preventive Diplomacy for Central Asia (UNRCCA)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: The UNRCCA implements the concept of preventive diplomacy in practice through enhanced dialogue, confidence building measures and genuine partnerships in responding to existing and emerging challenges in Central Asia.

entity_long: Office of the United Nations Representative to the Geneva International Discussions
combined: Office of the United Nations Representative to the Geneva International Discussions (UNRGID)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East
combined: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA)
description: The UNRWA carries out direct relief and works programmes for Palestine refugees.

entity_long: United Nations Register of Damage Caused by the Construction of the Wall in the Occupied Palestinian Territory
combined: United Nations Register of Damage Caused by the Construction of the Wall in the Occupied Palestinian Territory (UNRoD)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNRoD's mandate is to serve as a record, in documentary form, of the damage caused to all natural and legal persons concerned as a result of the construction of the Wall by Israel in the Occupied Palestinian Territory.

entity_long: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process
combined: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for the Middle East Peace Process (UNSCO)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: The DPPA supports UN peacemaking efforts in various ways, including by advising and assisting the Secretary-General in his Middle East diplomacy and by overseeing UN political activities in the region.

entity_long: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for Lebanon
combined: Office of the United Nations Special Coordinator for Lebanon (UNSCOL)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: The UNSCOL provides leadership and coordination to UN efforts in Lebanon, assistinng the country in forging a peaceful, stable and democratic future.

entity_long: United Nations Support Mission in Libya
combined: United Nations Support Mission in Libya (UNSMIL)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNSMIL, in full accordannce with the principles of national ownership, is an integrated special political mission that supports support Libya's new transitional authorities in their post-conflict efforts.

entity_long: United Nations Assistance Mission in Somalia
combined: United Nations Assistance Mission in Somalia (UNSOM)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNSOM works with the Government of Somalia to support national reconciliation, provide strategic and policy advice on peacebuilding and state-building, to monitor the human rights situation and help coordinate the efforts of the international community.

entity_long: United Nations Support Office in Somalia
combined: United Nations Support Office in Somalia (UNSOS)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: The UNSOS provides critical support to institutions in Somalia to make them more effective in defeating enemies of peace and in creating space for political reconciliation and state formation.

entity_long: United Nations System Staff College
combined: United Nations System Staff College (UNSSC)
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council
description: The UNSSC delivers high-quality learning programmes and tailored solutions for UN staff and partners, equipping them with the knowledge and skills to support important UN activities and objectives.

entity_long: United Nations Transitional Assistance Mission in Somalia
combined: United Nations Transitional Assistance Mission in Somalia (UNTMIS)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)

entity_long: United Nations Truce Supervision Organization
combined: United Nations Truce Supervision Organization (UNTSO)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: UNTSO observers monitor ceasefires, supervise armistice agreements, prevent isolated incidents from escalating and assist other United Nations peacekeeping operations in the Middle East.

entity_long: United Nations University
combined: United Nations University (UNU)
results_framework: No centralized RBM results framework found
un_principal_organ: General Assembly / Economic and Social Council
description: The mission of the UN University is to contribute, through collaborative research and education, to efforts to resolve the pressing global problems of human survival, development and welfare.

entity_long: United Nations Verification Mission in Colombia
combined: United Nations Verification Mission in Colombia (UNVMC)
category: Subsidiary Organs (Peacekeeping operations and political missions)
description: The Mission will verify the reintegration of former FARC-EP members into political, economic and social life and the security guarantees for former FARC-EP members, their families, and communities in the territories.

entity_long: United Nations Youth Office
combined: United Nations Youth Office (UNYO)

entity_long: Universal Postal Union
combined: Universal Postal Union (UPU)
description: The UPU aims to secure the organisation and improvements of postal services, promote international collaboration and undertake technical assistance in postal matters requested by members countries.

entity_long: Office of the Victims' Rights Advocate
combined: Office of the Victims' Rights Advocate (VRA)

entity_long: World Bank
combined: World Bank (WB)

entity_long: World Food Programme
combined: World Food Programme (WFP)
comment: https://www.wfp.org/stories/how-wfp-demonstrates-accountability-and-transparency
description: The WFP was established as the UN System's food aid organisation. It is the world's largest humanitarian agency fighting hunger worldwide.

entity_long: World Health Organization
combined: World Health Organization (WHO)
description: Article 1 of the Constitution defines the WHO's objective as "the attainment by all peoples of the highest possible level of health". The detailed functions are set out in article 2 of the Constitution.

entity_long: World Intellectual Property Organization
combined: World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO)
description: The WIPO is dedicated to developing a balanced and accessible international intellectual property system that stimulates innovation and contributes to economic development while safeguarding public interest.

entity_long: World Meteorological Organization
combined: World Meteorological Organization (WMO)
description: The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) is the successor to the International Meteorological Organization, which was established in 1873.

entity_long: World Trade Organization
combined: World Trade Organization (WTO)
description: The WTO is the only global international organization dealing with the rules of trade between nations. At its heart are the WTO agreements, negotiated and signed by the bulk of the world’s trading nations.
